author: Jeff Brown
title: Chinese Surgeons Visit NYC to Observe Orthopedic Surgeon Leon E. Popovitz
text:
A delegation of Chief Surgeons of the Central Hospital of Yongzhou in China will be visiting New York City this Tuesday, October 6, 2015, to observe Leon E. Popovitz, MD , co-founder and chief orthopedic surgeon of New York Bone & Joint Specialists, perform arthroscopic surgery of the shoulder and arthroscopic surgery of the knee. The Chinese surgeons' goal is to learn how to improve the orthopedic surgery healthcare for patients in China. In addition to viewing Dr. Popovitz' expertise in arthroscopic surgery, his associate, Rupesh Tarwala, MD, will provide a lecture on robotic computer technology for hip joint replacement, comparing the anterior hip replacement and posterior hip replacement approaches.
In light of Chinaâ€™s short history with arthroscopic and joint replacement procedures, the delegation aims to exchange knowledge on innovative technologies in arthroscopic surgery, joint replacement surgery and post-operative rehabilitation. Leon E. Popovitz, MD, a top Orthopedic Arthroscopic Shoulder and Knee surgeon, and his staff, are honored to have the opportunity to offer their knowledge to China's leading orthopedic surgeons.
They will be observing Leon E. Popovitz, MD perform the following orthopedic procedures:
Shoulder Arthroscopic Surgery : Arthroscopic Labral Repair, Bankart Repair and Rotator Cuff Repair
Knee Arthroscopic Surgery : Anterior Cruciate Ligament (ACL) Reconstruction, and Arthroscopic Surgery for Meniscus Tear
About Leon E. Popovitz, MD
Leon E. Popovitz, MD is a best rated orthopedic surgeon that specializes in Arthroscopic Surgery of the Shoulder and Knee. He treats professional athletes from all over the world and is the co-founder of New York Bone & Joint Specialists, a top rated Orthopedic Surgery and Sports Medicine practice in New York City. Leon E. Popovitz, MD is known for his exemplary arthroscopic surgical skills that has helped athletes of all levels return to their top physical potential.
